conclusion: The angle of the light rope on both sides of the pulley is 90°, and the tension in the rope is equal to the weight of block B.
Tension in the rope (T) is equal to the weight of block B (W_B), so T = W_B.
The inclination of the smooth slope is 30°, and the component of the gravitational force acting along the slope is m*g*sin(30°).
For block A to remain stationary, T = m*g*sin(30°).
Substitute T with W_B: W_B = m*g*sin(30°).
W_B is the weight of block B, expressed as W_B = m_B*g.
Divide both sides by g: m_B = 0.5*m.
The mass of block B is half the mass of block A.
